text:
Bottle at Dobry Zbeer

Notes of wood, smoked peat, roasted almond. Taste was smoother then the aroma Nice Islay whiske aroma. Sweet figs, carmel and wanilla. Great

From the bottle, at Baladin, Bologna, Italy. Pours brilliant brown, no foam. Aroma is delicate smoky and peaty, still rather delicate. Body is dense and without carbonation. Medium astringency. Taste has some intense sweetness mediated by the literary and smoked feelings. Finish is very enjoyable and sweet.

(bottle-2011 vintage)
Aroma:sweet toffee,honey,berry-like fruitniess,hint of peated whiskey,raisins.
Appearance:dark amber color,no head.
Taste:uber sweet,flavour of berry fruits,bit tart,toffee,weak hint of peated smoke,sweet syropy finish.
Palate:full body,ultra thick syropy texture,no carbonation.
Overall:Lovely thick dessert-like brew,syrupy thick texture together with malty toffee-like notes makes it one hell of the barley wine although barrel notes are very settled.

375ml bottle ([email¬†protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */¬ís) 2010 vintage
Heavy tarry aroma. Dark, flat. Lovely sweet body, a bit syruppy. However, it¬ís so incredibly mellow. Tarriness in the taste balances with the sweetness perfectly. One smidge either way and it would be off-kilter, but this is just right. Great sipper.

Bottle pour at Baladin Bologna. Lightly smoky in the nose, very oxidized as usual. Clear brown-orange, flat. More smoke in the flavor with some peat, though a very good and unobtrusive amount. Cherry, caramel, orange. Silky, oily, perfect body. tobacco. Acid and smoke work perfectly to balance the sweetness. Awesome.
Aromat bardzo s≈Çodki, wanilia, toffi. W smaku kr√≥wki, wanilia, toffi, lekkie suszone owoce, bardzo s≈Çodkie. Przepiƒôkne piwo.

Vintage 2012 bottle. Dark brown, little bit hazy, no head, completely flat... just doesn¬ít look nice. Amazing and very rich and strong sweet, malty aromas with heavy whiskey tones and some dried fruits in the background. Full body, very sweet with oily texture and smooth, sticky mouth feel. Slight spicy alcohol feeling in the warming finish is balancing the sweetness. Great stuff! One of those beers to be remembered.

Vintage 2010. Bottle @ DobryZbeer. Pours brown, hazy, no head. One of the most complexed aromas ever tried. First sniff - whisky, barrel made huge impact, peat. smoke. Then cherries, lots of smoke, bacon even, dry fruits, gean, wood, raisin. In mouth very sweet, syrupy. No bitterness, no alcohol. Long heavy aftertaste of whisky or rather whisky liqueur. Super dense and oily. Amazing experience.

Bottle from a friend (2010 bottle). Brown color, minimal white head. Bittersweet taste with raisins, toffee, syrup, peat, caramel, oak, malts, smoke and vanilla. Bitter finish with raisins, oak, caramel, peat, toffee and syrup. Very nice brew, although a bit too sweet after aging.

Ayy lmao, after that beer the world will be slightly different. 2011 version. Aroma: Dried fruit, barrel, light peat, slightly alcoholic. Appearance: Dark ruby body, no head. Taste: Dense, lots of dried fruit with barrel notes, wood, vanilla, peat, slight licqueur alcohol.

Bottle. Dark amber color with a small off-white head. Has a fruity malty spicy smoky caramel aroma. Fruity malty spicy smoky caramel flavor. Has a fruity malty spicy smoky caramel finish with weak hints of dark fruit.

2011 vintage. Beer is transparent, almost clear with just a tiny pieces of yeast. Color is deep amber with a super awesome golden reflections. No head obviously. Very rich, thick and dense aroma, full of raisins, dates, plums, red wine, wood and a touch of strong alcohol whisky-like. Mouthfeel is perfect. It¬ís obviously totaly flat, no carbonation at all, but the smoothness, and the velvety feeling is super-pleasant, no words can describe it. Taste has many layers. It want to be sweet but the main notes - whisky barrel note, is dragging down the sweetness, so in the end it Appears to be rather dry. There is also like a thousends notes of plums and dates. There is even brush of bitterness in the aftertaste, but it¬ís very like wooden one. Amazing beer, really close to perfect one.
Bottle thanks to Darrel. Pours out a copper orange color. Nose is sweet caramel toffee malts some peat notes. Taste is more of the sweet malt caramel toffee and barrel.
Bottle from Darrell. 2006 vintage. Big and boozy, plenty of heat. Sweet, but the heat is what all this about. Nice velvety texture, sweet finish.

2011, bottle shared with heavy and Erna, like every other on this tasting, but courtesy of them as well this time, enormous thanks you two! Clear, lovely golden/amber body, full, big legs, no head. Full, lovely, complex aroma, caramel, peat, figs, dried fruit, light alcohol, thankfully no negative effects of oxidation. Hats off. Taste... sweet obviously, malty, big caramel mixing with soooft peat, light figs, big vanilla, very light alcohol, very light oxidation. Soft as f*ck, warming, just damn enjoyable, not cloying at all, a superb sipper. I don¬ít rate a beer over 4 often. This deserved it. A beer of a style that I admittedly don¬ít even usually like that much executed nigh-perfectly. Baladin, you rock.
Backlog, ocena przepisana z untappd, w ramach uzupe≈Çniania profilu na ratebeer.

Bottle; pours dark amber with no head; sweet aroma of dark fruits, whiskey, tobacco, some smoke and caramel; taste is sweet with caramel, malt, dark fruits, some smoke, and whiskey; finish dry with some smokiness; complex and nicely balanced

Kolor: bursztynowy, delikatnie zamglony.
Piana: brak.
Zapach: intensywne aromaty beczki, whisky, wƒôdzonki torfowej, r√≥wnie du≈ºo aromat√≥w charakterystycznych dla barley wine, suszonych owoc√≥w, rodzynek, fig, daktyli, ca≈Ço≈õƒá s≈Çodka, alkohol bardzo subtelny, kojarzƒÖcy siƒô z whisky.
Smak: gƒôste, oleiste, wyklejajƒÖce, s≈Çodkie, likierowe, dominujƒÖ nuty suszonych, ciemnych owoc√≥w, daktyli, fig, rodzynek, nuty beczki na dalszym planie, wyra≈∫nie wyczuwalna whisky, lekka wƒôdzonka torfowa, nuty drewna, alkohol bardzo dobrze ukryty, przyjemnie rozgrzewa w ≈ºo≈ÇƒÖdku.
Wysycenie: brak.

August 2016 - Served gravity dispense from a tiny oak barrel at GBBF 2016 as ¬íBaladin Xyauy√π Fum√©¬í, 14%, Islay BA. Very dark brown with a red hue, no head at all. Aroma is smoke, raisin, toffee, sugars, peat. Body is smooth with low carbonation. Taste is a smooth marriage between sweet honey-ish malt and Islay whiskey ¬ñ sherry, raisin, smoke, molasses, booze. Wow. Easily the best barley wine I¬íve ever had. (4.1)

Bottle at GBBF 2016, massive thanks to Daniel. It pours clear rich red - brown with a small head. The aroma is rich, roasted malts, bitter - sweet, smoked peat, toast, whisky, toffee, fruit cake and alcohol sting. The taste is slick, sweet, juicy, fruit cake, treacle, figgy pudding, plum, malt loaf, alcohol warmth, wood, slight acidity, umami, smokey whisky and some caramelised banana with a slick, warming finish. Full body, low carbonation and oily mouth - feel. Great depth of flavour. Very nice sipper.

Bottle (2010 Vintage) - Dark in colour. Leather, marzipan, berries and nuts in the aroma. Fruity taste with leather, berries, smoked malt and marzipan. There¬ís a lot going on here, perhaps a bit too much.

Bottled. Pours clear brown with a small off-white head. Aroma of caramel, peat, wood, whiskey and dried fruit. Sweet flavor that ends up being more dry with some alcohol. Medium bodied, oily to syrupy texture and soft carbonation. An excellent Barley. üåüüåüüåüüåü

Style et r√©sum√©:  Xyauy√π en f√ªt de Scotch Islay, version 2011
Comment: D√©gustation au Saint-Bock. 
Portrait:  Un liquide ambr√©e sans mousse ou p√©tillement. Un nez avec des notes de tourbe, iode, m√©dicamenteux, pas d√©sagr√©able, Une bouche avec des saveurs iod√©es, tourb√©es, pas d¬íalcool. Une petite chaleur en fin de bouche. Un produit agr√©able et distinctif. 
Note:  8/10

Sampled at a tasting. Hazy brown pour, no head or carbonation visible. Smells like cocoa, nuts and bourbon. Tastes like cocoa, milk chocolate, chestnuts, whiskey, sugar, figs and coconut. Medium body, no carbonation and alcohol in the aftertaste.

Murky copper color with no head. Aroma has dark sugar, dark fruits like figs and dates. Taste starts sweet and fruity with figs, plums, raisins, dates. Finishes slightly bitter with a light whisky note. Body is flat and syrupy. Really complex taste, sweet, dark fruit forward, with very well hidden ABV.

[email¬†protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */ Tuesday Bottle Share, Copenhagen - Dark brown Amber pour with tiny beige head. Aroma and taste is rich malty and dark fruity, real Christmas cake fruity medley, sultana, nutty, lovely Islay whisky infused wooden notes, great smokey notes, lovely stuff.
50 cl. bottle. Hazy dark brown colour with a small off-white head. Aroma and flavour alcohol, dried fruit, malt, caramel, bread, spice and whiskey.

Bottled. A hazy amber beer with a small beige head. The aroma has notes of alcohol, oxidation, malt, smoke, whiskey, and sirup. The flavor is very sweet with notes of alcohol, malt, smoke, and whiskey, oxidation, and caramel, leading to a dry alcoholic finish.

50 cl bottle. Pours hazy brown with a small tan head. Aroma is oxidised and slight smoked to peated. Smooth, dense malty, rich, peated and dark caramelish. Smoked and toasted malty finish. Smooth peated and caramelish malty finish.

500 ml. bottle. Thanks Mike. Pours a somewhat hazy amber with no head to speak of. Aroma of malt, caramel, fruit, and whiskey. Taste is sweet malt, fruit, caramel, vanilla, whiskey, and smoke. Excellent to sip on.

UPDATED: FEB 14, 2016 2011, Lotto L063/140, aperta il 13 Febbraio 2016.
Rossa scura, limpida, con riflessi caramello e rubino, schiuma inesistente.
Aroma affumicato predominante misto a vino liquoroso e caramello, lievissime note di anice.
Al palato stesse caratteristiche, man mano che si scalda vengono fuori uva passa e amarena, lievi note di whisky, arricchite da una elegante coda erbacea e affumicata.
Corpo pieno, poco carbonata, texture oleosa.

Sample from bottle at Owl Farm, New York. Vintage 2010. Colour is clear dark copper with almost no head. Aromas and flavours: Dry fruits, warm whiskey, some sweetness and malts. Aroma is great and flavours are soft. One of the best whiskey barrel aged beers I have had (or best). Lingering. Great aging.

Bottled 500ml. -Courtesy of and shared with Domagoj (thanks!). Clear amber coloured, no head at all, light burnt plastic and smoke in the nose. Sweet malty, caramel and alcohol with distinct islay smoke presence. Also pleasant smoky finish. Really great brew.
Espectacular cervesa que no sembla cervesa. Aromes, sabors i textura molt similars als Islay Whisky. Per veure mica en mica...

Bottle sample at Open Baladin Rome Italy 03.12.2015.Tsste with ippopotamo36 bro, Mortlach and cika Boban.Fume 2011.Pour it hazy brown color with no head.Aroma sweet, smoked little bit, whiskey aroma . Taste dark fruits, sweet caramel, whiskey, papagalo shit as Alberto said.Good balanced.

Bottle. Pours clear viscous and vinous and no head at all. Aroma is sweet and jammy, malts, tobacco, light smoke, sherry, deep, toffee. Candy. Vanilla, oak. Awesome smoke as it warms. Taste is sweet, malty, toffee, wet sweet tobacco, vanilla, oak. Light sherry, grapes, chocolate. Light toast. Finish balanced out by smoky dryness. Oily texture, no carbonation. Awesome.
Wow, this is the version aged in islay casks, drunk in the Baladin bar. A sensational beer.
Definitely a dessert beer. No head/almost flat. Very sweet with some bitter and peat. Excellent finish. Great sipping brew.

Pour from a bottle at the Baladin location in Rome. Brown pour, no head, into a Teku. Aroma of sweet caramel with lots of peaty smoke notes. Flavor is sweet caramel and smoke, lots of peat here, with beautiful oak and whiskey character. Rich body, low carbonation, really nice after dinner drink. Good stuff, but pricey for a bottle.

UPDATED: FEB 7, 2016 Botella, @Bir&Fud, Roma. 22/09/2015 Botella 2011. L:063/140
Color caoba oscuro, aroma malta, dulce, sabor ahumado, toques espaciados. cuerpo denso.

How: Bottle.
Where: Systembolaget.
Appearance: Dark red-brown colour without a head.
Aroma: Peat, smoke, caramel, some malt, raisin, dried fruit.
Body: Very full, thick body with almost no carbonation.
Flavour: Peat, smoke, caramel, dried fruit, whiskey, raisin.

150620. Thanks to Andy :-) Bottle. A bit hazy amber beer with no head at all.Caramell dark fruits whiskey licorice aroma. Malty caramel, dark fruits whiskey smoked licorice flavour. A truley Lovely beer :-)
Incredible bottle sharing at cask republic, stamford. Pure whisky aroma. Dense smoke and body. Great bw.
Pours ruby red with no head and carbonation. Aroma: vanilla, peaty whisky aroma, a touch of soil. Taste: malty sweetness followed by whisky-vanilla taste and a bit of sourness. Great.

Bottle, thanks to Andreas. Slightly hazy copper/brown beer with no head at all. Peated aroma, caramel, raisins, figs, whisky, toffee, licorice notes, grapes, some cherries. Malty caramel and fig flavor, smoked, raisins, toffee, oily, port, whisky, plums, some licorice. Extremely fullbodied and with alcohol quite well hidden. I like this.

Bottle 50cl / Botella 50cl.
@ XXXII The Great Power of Beer & Wine.
A: Amber / Ambar.
T/S: Raisins, smoke bacon, slightly fruity / Uvas pasas, bacon ahumado, ligeramente afrutado.
Very peaty aroma. The taste is actually very balanced. No carbonation. Sweet finish. Caramel, sherry and peat in the flavour.

Bottle from Belmont Station. Pours cola with no head and a smoky tea aroma. There is a sweet dark malt flavor with a lot of smoke and tea. It has all melted together over the years, creating an interesting taste. Also a nice whiskey finish.
2008 bottle shared by Marcus. Pours cola. Aroma is liquid smoke. Taste is BBQ ribs with oak and a little heat.

Sin espuma y casi sin carbonataci√≥n, color cobrizo. En aroma y sabor, una mezcla realmente conseguida entre un oloroso envejecido y una cerveza maltosa con un toque ahumado muy bien integrado. Much√≠simo cuerpo y presencia de alcohol, agradable, para la graduaci√≥n que tiene. Se presta al debate de qu√© se puede considerar cerveza. Impresionante.

Bottle. Brown body tan head. Aroma is smoke some dried red fruits some also some honey. Taste is nearly the same with some additional dark caramel. Mouthfeel is oily and thick. Aftertaste is sweet and smoke. Never can imagine to drink a bottle but a glass before the chimney would be great.

from bottle at Craft Beer Fest Vienna Tasting Sessions. red brownish light hazy color. no head. strong wooden taste, liqueur, malty sweetness, dried fruits, plums. full body, soft carbonation, full rather oily mouthfeel. strong wooden taste, malty sweetness, bitter sweet taste, dried fruits, plums, something is a bit weird about this taste. alcoholic / dried fruity finish. quite nice, liked the rum barrel aged a bit more.

Bottle shared by jackl at the C¬íVille Foxy Knoxy tasting. Hazy copper, thin head. Aroma of toffee, scotch, smoke. The taste is toffee, caramel, scotch whiskey, stone fruit, mild booze. Medium bodied.

Bottle @ The Foxy Knoxy Tasting. Hazy brown with a small head. Slightly peaty. Some of that TCP. Earth. Honey and cocoa. Taste of honey, smokey accents. Earth. Honey. Smokey. Quite sickly and rich. Full body. Earthy and full. Damn, girl.
Maraschino cherries, and cranberries nose. Clear auburn, thin head. Full body, warm. Nice character.
Bottle courtesy of jackl, thank you sir! Hazy brown color, tan edge head. Aroma of burnt toast with caramel sauce. Taste is sweet, syrupy, smoky. Interesting and unique.

2010 Laphroaig barrel aged. Really really sweet barley wine, with NO carbonation whatsoever.
Really round with alot of caramel, toffe and huge amounts of whisky/peated character. This is pretty exactly what it sounds like, whisky with barley wine base. Wonder where those 14% dissapears? Would have even better with less sweetness.

Bottle, 2008 vintage, thanks to Jeremy! Pours hazy reddish hazel, no head and no lacing. Aroma is super smokey, peat, bacon. Flavor is fully sweet and very smoky, meaty, scotch and honey glazed ham. Medium body, silky mouthfeel, no carbonation. This is definitely an odd one, but in the end the super sweetness and the smoke just don¬ít mix that well.
Deep brown, no foam. Very strongly peaty, super scotch aroma. Strangely sweet mix of smoky bacon, peat. Sweetness is a killer in contrast to the extreme smokiness.

Bottle... Pours clear and deeply copper with no head. The nose is smoky and woody with shades of caramel and bottlebrush honey. Surprisingly, this is not extraordinarily peaty. Full-bodied and viscous with no carbonation. The flavor is sweet and smoky with malty and vinous underpinnings of caramel, maple syrup and amber port. There¬ís an unfortunate cardboard-like nuance amid all the other esters and oxidation-related notes. Finishes sweet and smoky with only traces of acidity and cardboard. Although smoky, I¬ím not picking up the intense peaty characteristic I was expecting from a beer aged in Islay whiskey barrels. Enjoyability high - Drinkability low. A digestif. Bottle generously shared by ctipping!

Bottle. Dark brown color with minimal beige head. No carbonation. Strong peated aroma with dark malt, coffee,whiskey, medicinal notes. Heavy sweet taste with dried fruits, caramel, peat, whiskey, honey, earthy notes. Strong alcoholic finish. Very tasty sipper.
Bottle. Extreme strength apparent from the first moment, heavy mouthfeel, no carbonation. Dried fruits in flavour, caramel, liquorish, but exquisite. Very good.

Bottle shared by Cuso, many thanks. Pours brown color, nearly no head. Aroma is smoked, whiskey, medicinal notes, alcohol, coffee. Taste is sweet, medicinal notes, coffee, whiskey, chocolate, smoked. Lot of alcohol in The end.

[6487-20140708] Bottle. Roasted whiskey barrel peat aroma. Clear, dark brown amber body with no lasting head. Pepper chilli skin flavour has a huge whiskey barrel flavour. Full boozy body. Wow!! This is a surprise. (7/3-/6/3/15) 3.4
(Tasting at cgarvieuk¬ís, w/ him, BenH, jercraigs, Stuu666, others)
Birra tecnicamente perfetta, √® un barley wine servito dalla botte che profuma di vaniglia e torba, molto corposo, come un whisky da fine pasto.

Cervesa molt complexa, per beure amb molta calma ja que evoluciona en cada glop, es nota molt el toc turbat del whisky.
Cerveza muy compleja, para beber con mucha calma ya que evoluciona en cada sorbo, se nota mucho el toque turbado del whisky.

Spillata direttamente dalla botte @Eurhop 2014.
Ambrata carica liscia. Calda morbida eterna, con sfumature di affumicato.

At Eurhop festival in Rome-ITALY. Ouh boy! Pours foam-free, wood skin brown and clear. Nose of whiskey, caramel, liquor. Mouth is terrific. Sweet caramel, fresh cookies, dates. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottle at Craig¬ís. nose is sweat peat. tastes of caramel, cough syrup, figs, peat, soy sauce. Touch thin and maybe too sweet.

Bottle at Craig¬ís. Pours hazy amber with no head. Aromas is mostly cardboard I¬ím afraid, light fruit and smoke in the background. Taste is better, fruit coming through, only light smoke again. Finishes sweet and boozy. Not bad.

2014-07-08. Very dark brown body headless. Aroma is oddly smokey, lightly iodine, sweet malt core. Flavour is smokey over rich sweet core. Warming alcohol in the finish. Smooth average bodied palate, no carbonation. Not to my tastes. Bottle, Tasting at cgarvieuk¬ís, Edinburgh
Fantastico esempio di birra da gustare nelle tranquille serate. Perfetta con cioccolato amaro e aromatizzato.

From bottle at Craft Bier Fest Wien. Orange/brown clear body, with no head. Aroma mainly of whisky. Taste is very complex, sweet and clingy, almost Port Wine or Samos like, with whisky, honey, resin, peat, toffee. Mouthfeel is full, oily, with no carbonation and it finishes sweet, alcohol warming and complex. Outstanding! Never had a beer like this before, if you didn¬ít know it, you maybe wouldn¬ít guess that this is a beer. Extremely complex and aromatic.
Bottle at Craig¬ís tasting. Sweet, caramel, dry smoke, very peaty, little cardboard.

Bottle, thanks Craig. Brown with no head. Aroma is full on whisky, peat smoke. Taste is peaty, plenty of whisky, only a touch of the base beer shines through, quite one dimensional whisky but very nice. Sweet.

bottle at home .. copper .. thin white lacing ... .dark roast ... light islay smoke nose ...big massive islay nose .. sot sweet fruits ... soft toffe ... very sweet and bit oily fruits..light whisky ... big soft light smoke .. but very sweet

BEER CRAZIENESS! AFTERTASTE LASTS FOREVER. WHISKY FOR SURE. SMOKEY. CANDIED APPLE. PERFECT COLD WINTER DAY BEER. 


---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Very interesting and sperimental beer,draught many times,it has a very complex organoleptic profile. Starting sweet going to dry passing by every category of tasting aromas. Recommended

Bottle 500ml. [ Vintage 2008 - Bottle 28/120 ]. Clear medium to dark red brown color with a small, fizzy, fair lacing, mostly diminishing, off-white head. Aroma is moderate to heavy malty, heavy peat, tar, medicine, wood. Flavour is moderate to heavy sweet and light to moderate bitter with a long duration, peat, sweet malt, caramel, alcohol, wood. Body is medium, texture is creamy, carbonation is soft, finish feel is light to moderate alcoholic. [20131230]

Draught @ Open Baladin, Rome. Pours dark brown, no head, heavy lacings. Aroma of rich malt, caramel, sweet dark fruits, wood, whisky, smoke, peat, some alcohol. Flavor is rich and complex with sweet malts, caramel, wood, nice balanced smoke, Islay whisky, peat, sweet dried dark fruits, figs, plums in the background, booze. Cremy oily body, no carbonation, some warming alcohol but well controlled for the ABV. Excellent barley wine. 060414

Med √∂lf√∂reningen julen 2013. Smak och doft av korv, torv, j√§rnv√§gsslipers, medvurst, russin, dadlar, honung med r√∂kiga och torviga toner. En aning f√∂r s√∂t men riktigt gott. En flaska fr√•n 2010.

brown peated flat smoky whiskey sweet
Bel sentore affumicato ma in bocca si perde un po
Smokey as hell. Deep forest fire smoke. Smells like a good port wine. Heavy. Thick. Draft at Eataly. My friends are ready to throw up after this and I like it

2/1/2014. From bottle. Poured dark brown with no head. Syrupy sweet aromas with smoke. Peaty and smoky flavors, with sweetness from the oak. No carbonation at all. It¬ís definitely a different style of beer, and if you don¬ít appreciate Islay whisky, you may be in for a surprise. Not sure it¬ís worth the price point though.

Bottle. Pours clear red brown with no head or lace. Aroma is dark fruit, plum, strong oaky, whisky, mildly peated and smoked. Flavor is sweet and fruity up front, fig and plum, fading smoothly into peaty, strong whisky, smoky, bacon/jerky finish, mildly vinous. Even better, more complex as it warms. Alcohol is well hidden. Rich, sweet, fruity, more smoke and whisky as it warms up. Essentially no carbonation, medium body, and mildly juicy texture. Interesting, sweet, fruity, oaky barley wine. Very good.

Bomba a mano, sembra di bere un whiskey invecchiato senza percepire i gradi alcolici, bevendola richiama un torbato incredibile che si bilancia con uno speziato persistente al naso e al palato, non vorresti smettere di sorseggiarla,caretta di solito ma se li merita tutti

Flaska (2010) p√• ny√•rsafton. Doft av alkohol, aceton och k√∂ttkorv. H√∂g s√∂tma och smak av h√§stkorv och andra svagt r√∂kta charkuterier. Tung alkohol men i balans. Fatkarakt√§r av oklar genes, bara att l√§sa p√• etiketten f√∂r den som pallar.

Kobber klar skum lidt 
T√∏v r√∏g sukker t√∏mmer vanilje 
Bitter lidt s√∏d meget 
Sirup flad 
@peter c

Medicin ,malt, t√∏rv, peat, ingen skum , s√∏d, sirup , tung, bacon, fad, m√∏rk r√∏d .

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Deep mahogny colour. Aroma of nuts, ice tea, orange, dark fruit, leather, liver p√¢t√©, caramel, bbq, tar and loads of peat, Taste is very sweet combined with a meaty smokiness that¬ís almost overwhelming. Completely flat. Slightly bitter and very complex. Alcohol is very well hidden.

UPDATED: MAR 17, 2014 500ml beautifully designed black bottle with a wax-sealed cork, packaged in a tube. Appearance is cloudy dark mahogany with no head. A complex aroma of roasted malt, raisins, prunes, smoked charcuteries, caramel, toffee, muscovado and maple syrup. Taste is heavy on sweetness with a light bitterness. Mouthfeel is full bodied with a thick oily syrup like texture, carbonation is flat. The considerable 14% ABV is well masked, the alcohol is barely noticeable. A delicious beer that goes well with blue cheese, and the hint of smoked charcuteries was a pleasant surprise. However Baladin Xyauy√π Fum√© is expensive, and availability is limited, consider this a rare luxury.

Bottle. Light hazy deep brown liquid with small light tan head. Aroma of raw sugar, raisins, peat, chocolate, booze, wood, chocolate and bread. Taste is medium to high sweet and light bitter with notes of raw sugar, toffee, wood, peat and caramel. Full bodied with low carbonation. Very complex.

Flaska fr√•n SB. En 2010 flaska lagrad p√• Laphroaigfat drucken p√• jul√∂lsprovningen 2013. Stor r√∂kig och doft med torv och charkuterier ihop med stor s√∂ta honungsdofter. Smaken √§r rund, s√∂t och r√∂kig. Fina smaker av dadlar, russin och fikon m√∂ter medvurst och torv. Ingenting sticker ut och st√∂r men den stora s√∂tman och den torviga r√∂kigheten g√•r inte riktigt ihop i min mun. Trots det riktigt god.

Bottle (2010 Vintage) - Dark in colour. Leather, marzipan, berries and nuts in the aroma. Fruity taste with leather, berries, smoked malt and marzipan. There¬ís a lot going on here, perhaps a bit too much.

Glass at √òltorget Mathallen, july 12th 2013. Dark orange body, no head. Aroma of peat, raisins, caramel, blackcurrant, mango. Taste is lightly roasted with a good amount of Islay whisky, prunes, chocolate. Noticable alcohol level, giving a warm finish. Pretty sweet aftertaste with peated malt and mango. A great usage of barrelling in this one.

Bottle at Bistrot Baladin, Milan, vintage 2010, Brown color, clear, darker than the regular Xyauy√π. Strong peat aroma, marine; iodine; then some malt. Sweet flavor, malt with a strong peat edge, some salt and iodine; warming alcohol, but less evident than in other Xyauy√π.Good, but the (Laphroaig?) peat makes it more dull, where the old Lapsang Suchong X Fum√® had an edge more.

6/29/13. 500mL bottle shared by nulledge at the epic BA barleywine tasting. Rich amber brown pour, basically flat, as intended. This is very much like the "barrel" version we tried, as in it is ridiculously smooth and goes down easy for the ABV, and it has lots of burnt toffee, butterscotch, and dark fruit aspects, but the scotch is a bit of overkill for me personally... lots of peat, burnt plastic, and some metal. Not as big a fan as I was of the "barrel" version.

500, corked, waxed, and boxed. Thanks, B! What an amazing treat. Pours a cloudy, still dark brown with no head or lace. Some legs crawling up the glass. Big peaty, smoky nose, definitely shot through with Islay character for sure. Some dark toasty caramel and some black bread behind that as well. Sticky thick still body. Peat, campfire, bacon, beef jerky, black bread, and darkly toasted caramel on the mid palate. Long dark smoky sweet finish. In balance, intense, complex, and insanely pleasurable. Great beer.

Wow!  Is this really a beer?  An unbelievable aroma where I certainly get the port wine feeling. Boozy, cognac like - awesome!  It has such a light & drinkable mouthfeel at 14%. Very unique. It¬ís incredibly smooth until the smoky finish.  This is a treat!  Must try if you are an extreme beer lover!

Bevuta direttamente dalla botte in fase di affinamento. Birra ancora giovane ma esprime una potenza davvero unica nei profumi con note ossidate e torbate da wiskhy di grande intensit√†. In bocca molto simile alla xyauyu oro alla quale sono aggiunte gli aromi del laproaigh. Grande barleywine.

This one poured a somewhat murky dak amber to light brown color with basically no head at all. Aroma was lots of peaty smoked malts, mainly from the scotch barrel obviuosly, some toasted bread, dark fruits and caramel.  Flavor was similar, lots of scotch, caramel, dark fruits, light alcohol and some raisins too.

9th March 2013Craft Clerkenwell. Bottle thanks to Colin. Clear amber beer, residual pale tan head. Palate is light and a little dry. Smooth. Quite a sweet caramel malt with well integrated and smooth peat whiskey. A little generic fruit and lactose and a light smoky tang. Finishes smooth and dry. Hides the abv very well indeed. A real tasty treat as are most of the Xyauyu¬ís

50cl bottle at CBC Clerkenwell, London. Thanks to Colin. It pours a deep copper / brownish colour with no real head to speak of. Aroma  is sweet with peat notes, but not overwhelming at all. Maple syrup and dark fruits. Taste is still sweet with some peaty notes in the end. Vanilla, leather and tobacco, alongside with dark fruits and raisins. Silky body with no carbonation. Overall, delicious to me.

UPDATED: AUG 21, 2016 Bottle thanks Colin. Dark caramel. Bacon maple syrup, boozy aroma. Very sweet. Sryupy, coa Islay smooth. Very good. 

Cask at GBBF 2016 09/08/2016. A viscous,  brown coloured pour with no head.  Aroma is big tangy fruit,  woody,  brown  sugars,  boozy fruit cake, cherry.  Flavour is composed of sweet brown sugars  cakey malts,  sherry wood,  booze.  Palate is full and sticky,  sugary.  Very good complexity.

UPDATED: OCT 19, 2016 Bottle shared at CBC - Clerkenwell, London. Huge thanks to Colin for this one. Pours clear, dark red-brown with a fine, beige head. Massive smokey peat nose, some toasty and syrupy sugars. Big sweet flavor, obscene amounts of smokey bacon drenched in maple syrup, some alcohol, brown sugar, toasty brown bread. Full bodied with fine carbonation. Fairly chewy. Tons of cured ham, brown sugar, some honey, hefty smokey peat, mellow earthy bitterness. Light warmth. Lingering brown sugar, cured ham. Really awesome. This beer is miraculously rich. (Summer 2013, score: 4.4)Cask at GBBF 2016. Day 1. Pours oily black with a creamy topping. Wow kind of stuff. Big and sweet, sugary, with lots of smoke, brown sugar. Full bodied, oily and chewy, with fine carbonation. Warming in the finish, with ripe fruits, toasted sugars, smoked malts. Delicious, decadent. (August 2016, score: 4.3)

Nose islay pepper caramel. Taste caramel islay smoked meat huge sweetness. Body viscous. Too sweet for me.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Glass poured from corked bottle at home, also rated at Ma Che a few weeks previously, massive thanks to Luca (Mortlach) for gifting me this bottle! 19/02/13. Bottle No. L028/120, 2008 reserva.
Almost clear chestnut brown, slight reddish hues, almost vintage port like, with no head.
Nose is peat, smoke, wood, smoked gammon, brown sugars, burnt toffee, TCP, medicinal notes.
Taste comprises much of the nose elements, sweet smoked sugars, big boozey hit, Seville orange, wood, smoked gammon.
Full bodied, smooth, no carbonation, massages the throat leaving a sweet and smoked coating.
Excellent stuff - definately the best smoked offering I¬íve had, could dig this out as a night cap again and again !!!
user_location: Hazlemere, the lower Xhitlerns, Buckinghamshire, ENGLAND

text: Bottle sample from Bill at TND. Notes of barbecue, smoked peat, roasted almond. Taste was smoother then the aroma but still way too much for me.

La xyauy√π base riposa per un anno in botti di Laphroaig sprigionando tutto il potenziale dell¬íesperimento di Teo. Una nota torbata preponderante sporca il dolce del malto e della frutta matura. Al tasting √® complessa e molto corposa, una birra da grandi occasioni.

Favoloso color rame scuro, limpido con riflessi rubino in controluce; completamente priva di schiuma e carbonazione. Al naso colpisce con sentori torbati e fumosi, di legno e cenere su una base pi√π dolciastra con caramello e malto, meraviglioso equilibrio complessivo. Gusto pieno e rotondo, l¬íaffumicato avvolge le note fruttate e maltate alla perfezione, retrogusto persistente. Calda e vellutata al palato, √® meno corposa e "spessa" dell¬íatteso ma lascia le papille gustative in estasi. Un esperimento incredibile..!

Bottle shared by masterski. Thanks Alex!

Hazy and light orange, the beer is transparent with a small and fleeting head. The aroma offers ample smoke with some sweet, candied malt. Wow, this is delicious. Tea flavors emerge more in the flavor than the aroma. Quite tasty. Lovely feel. Silky smooth with a mild and delicate warmth. Fabulous for sipping. Would love to have this again.

Serving type: bottle

Reviewed on: 03-31-2012

29/10/2012 in Open Baladin
Xyauyu 2009
Pours of absolutely clear dark copper color with no head, lovely!
Aroma is very elegant, a bit caramely sweet, raisins and dark fruits in the back. Could feel some tropical fruits like mango as well.
Taste is a bit messy. comparing to aroma. 
Absolutely still, no carbonation at all.
Actually, quite interesting mix of flavours, but unfortunately having a strong alcohol tone in it. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

22/09/2012 Open Baladin 3rd Birthday (Barrique). Versata in teku direttamente dalla botte. Bellissimo color rame, con caldi riflessi arancia-rubino, intensissimo, schiuma assente. Al naso ha decise note torbate, sullo sfondo frutta matura, sciroppo d¬íacero, ossidazione, alcol. In bocca √® stupefacente, dolce, intensa, calda, con note torbate, incredibilmente complessa, simile a un Whisky. Corpo pieno, setosa, vellutata, piatta. Assolutamente spiazzante. Una birra clamorosa.

Una di quelle birre che lasciano il segno. Ho avuto la fortuna di assaggiarla durante un evento all¬íOpen Baladin di Roma, √® spiazzante la complessit√† di questo barley wine. Colore perfetto tra il rame e il rubino, consistenza oleosa, fluttua nel bicchiere come un whiskey pregiato. L¬íannusi, la sorseggi ti rendi conto delle potenzialit√† di una birra clamorosa che non teme confronti, neanche oltreoceano. Subito le note affumicate "dolci", poi frutta sotto spirito, spezie orientali, torba e ancora quel dolce che accarezza il palato nasconde l¬íalcool ed esalta un made in Italy da esportare con fierezza! p.s. Non chiamatelo barley wine ... si offende !!!1

S√º√üer, unglaublich voller Beginn mit Honig- und Whiskynoten, die beide im Mittelteil noch intenisver werden. S√º√ü bleibend, voll, rauchig, mild aber denoch voll und ausgeglichen. D√∂rrobst. /13/14/13//13

UPDATED: JAN 8, 2013 Non ne ricordavo il nome, comunque un dei migliori barley wine mai bevuti. Un whisky torbato ma pi√π dolce che accarezza il palato anzich√® aggredirlo. Semplicemente fantastico!!! Prima di acquistarlo in bottiglia passer√† almeno un altro anno in botte, chiss√† come diventer√†. Potenzialmente al livello della X-Fum√®.

Tap @ open baladin - Roma A really masterpiece. I hardly remember a such complex and satisfying. mouthfeel. Despite the alcohol and the smokiness it seemed to drink silk
Probably it might deserve a higher score but this beer is actually a little bit far away from what i think a beer should be. a fancy and elegant low alcohol whisky. I OMG how good this was...

Se in anteprima sta gi√† messa cos√¨, figuriamoci quando uscir√† dalla botte cosa potr√† essere. Lieto di esser stato uno dei privilegiati a poterla assaggiare, anche se solo due dita. Anche qui temperatura di servizio eccessivamente alta

Aroma: whiskey, malts, peat
Appearance: amber
Taste: complex, sweet and smoked, a hint of bitterness.
Palate: full bodied
Overall: 18/20
